title: (x) Shrek logo and credits - custom designed {Satya, Yves}
content:
Hi all,

Can you please help me identify the font used for the beginning of the Shrek movie, where the names of the actors are shown such as Mike Myers, Cameron Diaz, John Lithgow?

The link to the intro of Shrek is below  
 [http://youtube.com/watch?v=pIXBGVbdA24](http://web.archive.org/web/20071219010120/http:/youtube.com/watch?v=pIXBGVbdA24 "http://youtube.com/watch?v=pIXBGVbdA24")

Thank you

 [‹ (x) Yarck Cocksfoot italic compact sans - Antique Olive Nord {Akira}](http://web.archive.org/web/20071219010120/http:/typophile.com/node/38193 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Spider-man movie credits - Delux {Yves} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071219010120/http:/typophile.com/node/38196 "Go to next forum topic")
author: fishy

comments.content: Are you talking about the font used in the name Shrek itself\_?

both.

but more about the fonts used for the actors’ names
Those are not fonts, the letters are made by mud and stuff. I don’t think the character shapes are based on any existing typeface. Duplicate characters look different — no two letters are identical.

Dunno about the original font used in the name Shrek but here is a similar free font,  
 [http://www.dailyfreefonts.com/fonts/infos/1861-Shrek.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20071219010120/http:/www.dailyfreefonts.com/fonts/infos/1861-Shrek.html "http://www.dailyfreefonts.com/fonts/infos/1861-Shrek.html")

Rest everything I guess were designed and animated in 3d softwares like Maya or XSI itself.
